item.title: How would i run a client on a mac
item.dc:creator: @runegay runegay
item.description:
@runegay wrote:

just downloaded it and got this

cody-melthratters-computer:~ codymelthratter$ Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: Bad version number in .class file
-bash: Exception: command not found
cody-melthratters-computer:~ codymelthratter$         at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
-bash: syntax error near unexpected token `('
cody-melthratters-computer:~ codymelthratter$         at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:620)
-bash: syntax error near unexpected token `('
cody-melthratters-computer:~ codymelthratter$         at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:124)
-bash: syntax error near unexpected token `('
cody-melthratters-computer:~ codymelthratter$         at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:260)
-bash: syntax error near unexpected token `('
cody-melthratters-computer:~ codymelthratter$         at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:56)
-bash: syntax error near unexpected token `('
cody-melthratters-computer:~ codymelthratter$         at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:195)
-bash: syntax error near unexpected token `('
cody-melthratters-computer:~ codymelthratter$         at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
-bash: syntax error near unexpected token `('
cody-melthratters-computer:~ codymelthratter$         at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188)
-bash: syntax error near unexpected token `('
cody-melthratters-computer:~ codymelthratter$         at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
-bash: syntax error near unexpected token `('
cody-melthratters-computer:~ codymelthratter$         at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:268)
-bash: syntax error near unexpected token `('
cody-melthratters-computer:~ codymelthratter$         at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251)
-bash: syntax error near unexpected token `('
cody-melthratters-computer:~ codymelthratter$         at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:319)
-bash: syntax error near unexpected token `('
cody-melthratters-computer:~ codymelthratter$         at client.main(client.java:2583)
-bash: syntax error near unexpected token `('

item.source: How would i run a client on a mac

item.title: How would i run a client on a mac
item.dc:creator: @runegay runegay
item.description:
@runegay wrote:

i found that this works but i got one error:

cd ~/Desktop/Client
javac *.java
java -Xmx256m client

i got this error

Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
cody-melthratters-computer:~/Desktop/Client codymelthratter$ java -Xmx256m client
Loading Client
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: Bad version number in .class file
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:620)
        at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:124)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:260)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:56)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:195)
        at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
        at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:268)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:319)
        at client.main(client.java:2583)

Read full topic

item.title: How would i run a client on a mac
item.dc:creator: @Pilldom Pilldom
item.description:
@Pilldom wrote:

God ive answered the same question 3 times today… search on the forums a little jeez. You can run any client/source on a mac. All you need to do is learn how to use terminal. If you go to silabs forums and go to C&P tuts there is a tut on page 3-5 on how to do it. look around a little first.

Read full topic
